title: Apple and Fig Stuffed Pork Chops

ingredients.content: 4 pork chops, bone in, thick cut (1¼-1½ in.) (approx. 2-2½ lb total)
6 dried figs, e.g., Turkish or Calimyrna (approx.  3.5 oz)
3 oz cremini or baby portobello  mushrooms, quartered
4 oz Pink Lady apples, diced (¼ in.)
16 oz baby rainbow carrots, trimmed, peeled

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with foil and set aside.
With a sharp knife, cut a deep pocket into each pork chop. Season chops with 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp thyme and set aside.
Place figs into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 8<b>.
Add onion, mushroom, celery, bread crumbs, garlic, ½ tsp salt and sage and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add apples and mix <b>5 sec//speed 1.5<b>. Spoon stuffing mixture (approx. 4 oz ea.) into pork chop cavities. Bake for 35-45 minutes (375°F), until cooked to an internal temperature of 155°F. Meanwhile rinse mixing bowl and make sauce.

hintsAndTricks: To sear the stuffed pork chops before baking: heat 2 tbsp unsalted butter in a large skillet and sear each side until browned (approx. 2 min.).
Garnish with fresh thyme and sliced dried figs.
Color of the resulting sauce will depend on the carrot medley. For a pink sauce use purple carrots.
